Text.Value: Did you find valuables in the ruins?

EditorData.logicalname: Know what he was doing here

Text.Value: How do I get into the crypt?
Leave.
*The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*
Thieving. Looting. Cutting throats... wherever there's gold...
Do you have many people inside?
Who was this chapel dedicated to?

EditorData.logicalname: Player doesn't know chapel is dedicated to Jergal

Text.Value: Did you know you were breaking into a chapel dedicated to Jergal?
What is your profession?
Door sealed... can't break it... can't pick it... must be something...
What's inside this place?
Handful... Andorn guarding the door. The rest searching...
Do you have any valuables?
What were you doing here?
Some... but lower crypt locked...
Gimblebock...
*The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*
*The corpse regards you lifelessly.*
Who are you?
Looting... chapel ruins...
*The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*
No. Doesn't matter... if his loot's good...
The others, searching... chapel ruins. Can't get into lower crypt...
*The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*
Looking for valuables... chapel...

Synopsis: Speak with Dead dialogue with Gimblebock - the leader of the bandits who're looting the ruined chapel near where the player first wakes up. Gimblebock's answers are fragmented, cryptic. He can only draw on info that he knew when he was alive, and will refuse to speak to his killer if he recognises them. After a maximum of five questions, he'll fall silent for good.
